oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Rural areas; Country life; Rifles

Ganier, Albert Franklin, 1883-1973; York, Alvin Cullum, 1887-1964; Sergeant York (Motion picture); Tennessee -- Social life and customs; Appalachians (People) -- Tennessee; Rural families -- Appalachian region; Rifle practice
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Ten men face the camera in a clearing, all but the youngest wearing hats, one quite large. The largest two men stand in front of the others. Only two guns can be seen. The largest man wears bib overalls with extra material added at the cuffs.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Albert F. Ganier
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A backwoodsman is a person who is acclimated to living in a forest area that is far removed from civilization or modern conveniences.
